name: Aviator Cap & Car Seat Cover
description:
This aviator hat was designed for a friends grandson who was born premature at 28 weeks gestation. (He’s doing great and will be going home for Christmas!)

*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.*

The following hat sizes included with the pattern: 
Small Preemie (1-3 lbs)
Preemie (3-5 lbs)
0 - 3 months 
3 - 6 months 
6 - 18 months 

The are 2 sizes for the car seat cover and it also comes with and without instructions for the seat belt hole (check with state regulations).

The pattern will be emailed to you within 24 hours of payment.

Due to the nature of patterns, this crochet pattern may not be exchanged or returned for a refund. All sales are final. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

name: Awareness Ribbon Afghan Pattern pdf 154
description:
This Awareness Ribbon Project is my newest work of {he}art.
I have been working on this design for months. I wanted to show my life, and just what is important to me. I also wanted to support so many of my friends. Most of us are either in the midst of a struggle and/or trial, or know someone who is. Whether you are in the midst of a trial, have overcome your trial, or have suffered the loss of a loved one, your strength is amazing! My friends, and all of you, who overcome amazing things, are the true inspiration for this project.
There are 64 different squares pictured, but 70 different square combos included, which represent every single awareness ribbon I could find. Everything from blindness, asthma, food allergies, eczema, loss of a child, domestic abuse survivor, every cancer imaginable, diabetes, CHD, POTS, downs syndrome, autism, and so many more. The pattern has 17 pages, including 3 full pages of every color combo I could find, with the meaning of each one, plus photo tutorials to help you make each type of ribbon.

name: Summer Breeze Poncho Set Crochet Pattern for girls & their dolls PDF 180
description:
Our local library asked if I would donate something to their American Girl Doll Fashion Show. So, I designed this pattern and donated the finished items as the giveaway. The pattern works up fairly quickly and is great for those with basic crochet knowledge that would like to try something more. 

You will need to know tr stitch for this pattern, but their are instructions in the pattern, and a photo tutorial on my website. 

*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.*

The following sizes included with the pattern: 
American Girl Doll or 18" doll equivalent
4/6
8/10

name: Ripple Hat & Scarf Crochet Pattern Generations Set PDF 131
description:
*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.* 

Generations - Hat & Scarf Set
This set was a collaboration effort between myself & Diana, from Oz Dust Designs.
Hat pattern was created by me (Kristine - Ambassador Crochet)
Scarf pattern was created by Diana (Green Girl)

This set was made for both a mother and daughter (older daughter/younger daughter, aunt/niece, endless possibilities). The scarf is a one size fits all for the adult ladies (teen – adult) and the hat is sized for little girls and comes with 2 sizes (6 - 18 mos & 2T - 5T.)

The pattern was inspired by the Missoni fashion. It is a rippled zig-zag pattern style that has stood the test of time in the history of crochet & fashion. We chose the colors for the colder weather, but you could easily make it springy by changing to lighter colors. 

*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.* 

This pattern is suitable for the beginner but is great for anyone. You will need to know basic stitches, but I do offer pattern support for any questions that you may have.

description:
My 3 year old LOVES frogs, but especially tree frogs.  So, I decided to make her a tree frog hat.  I did some research and found out a red eyed tree frog has bright red eyes, orange feet, and bright blue and yellow sides...which is where my color scheme came from. You could easily make it a regular tree frog with just green and black and white eyes.
 
 
*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.*
 
I'm rating the feet advanced beginner, but the rest of the pattern is suitable for the beginner but great for anyone. You will need to know basic stitches, but I do offer pattern support for any questions that you may have.

name: Cables & Lace Beanie with Ruffled Flower Crochet Pattern PDF 089
description:
This beanie is made with cables and by crocheting backwards over stitches, and crossing them, it creates a sort of twisted lace.  This is NOT an easy pattern.  

This pattern is rated as INTERMEDIATE. I had almost a dozen pattern testers and no one with less than 5 years experience was able to figure it out.  This is not to scare you. I just want anyone interested to be aware that it is definately an intermediate pattern. Once you get the hang of how the pattern works, it actually works up pretty quickly.

*THIS LISTING IS FOR A PATTERN ONLY - NOT A FINISHED PRODUCT.*

My 7 year old daughter did the design for this hat. She knew what she wanted it to look like. All I had to do was crochet it and type up the instructions :). 

Thanks to those who asked for this in adult size.

Sizes available:
0 - 3 months
3 - 6 months
6 - 18 months
2T - 5T
5T - preteen
Teen/Adult

I do offer pattern support, so if you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

The pattern will be emailed to you within 24 hours of payment. 

Due to the nature of patterns, this crochet pattern may not be exchanged or returned for a refund. All sales are final. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

You are free to make any of my patterns to sell for profit, but please do not copy and/or redistribute the pattern itself.
